intro: Cyrtandra lessoniana var. borealis, commonly known as the northern cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside habitats. It has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This variant is distinguished by its geographic distribution and slightly different morphology compared to other varieties within the Cyrtandra genus.
